actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on April 13, 2023.
Pursuant to 2 U.S.C. 2081, the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the United States Capitol Preservation Commission: Ms. Kaptur (reappointed).

actions-list.header: Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 4703(b) of the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Exellence in Education Act (20 U.S.C. 4703), the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation: Mr. Larson of Connecticut.

actions-list.header: Commissioners to the United States Semiquincentennial Commission
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to Section 4 of the United States Semiquincentennial Commission Act of 2016 (Public Law 114-196), the Democratic Leader appointed the following members of the House to the Commissioners to the United States Semiquincentennial Commission: Mrs. Watson Coleman and Mr. Evans.

Pursuant to Section 4(b) of House Resolution 5, 118th Congress, the Democratic Leader appointed the following members of the House to the House Democracy Partnership: Ms. Titus, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, Mr. Lieu, Mrs. Torres of California, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Ms. Sewell, Ms. DeGette, Ms. Lee of California and Ms. Omar.

actions-list.header: Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 6913, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Congressional-Executive Commission on the People's Republic of China: Ms. Wexton, Ms. Wild and Ms. Salinas.

The Chair announced that the objections of the President to H.J. Res. 27 would be spread at large upon the Journal and the veto message would be printed as a House document (118-26). Further consideration of the veto message and the resolution, H.J. Res. 27, is postponed until the legislative day of April 18, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
The Chair laid before the House the veto message from the President.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk transmitted a sealed envelope received from the White House on April 6, 2023, at 1:25 p.m., said to contain a message from the President returning, without his approval, H.J. Res. 27.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Alexander X. Mooney to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
